sentence.text: We show that the protein polyubiquitination-106b-25 cluster upregulates cell cycle arrest in multiple breast cancer cell lines, representing both estrogen receptor (ER+) and triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) through direct repression of the E3 ubiquitin ligase, NEDD4L.

We further show that upregulation of NOTCH1 is necessary for TIC induction downstream of miR-106b-25 in both ER + and TNBC breast cancer cells, and that re-expression of regulation of membrane depolarization is sufficient to reverse miR106b-25-mediated NOTCH1 upregulation and TIC induction.
Further, we show for the first time that regulation of membrane depolarization expression alone is significantly associated with a better relapse-free prognosis for breast cancer patients.
Here we identify a novel mechanism of NOTCH regulation and TIC induction in breast cancer via the protein polyubiquitination-106b-25 miRNA cluster.
Tumor-initiating cells (regulation of ARF protein signal transduction) represent a subset of tumor cells with increased self-renewal capability.

entity.text: regulation of ARF protein signal transduction

sentence.text: NOTCH signaling has been identified as an important driver of the regulation of ARF protein signal transduction population, yet mechanisms governing regulation of this pathway in cancer remain to be fully elucidated.

entity.text: regulation of ARF protein signal transduction

sentence.text: Importantly, we demonstrate a significant positive correlation between protein polyubiquitination-106b-25 and NOTCH1 protein, yet a significant inverse correlation between miR-106b-25 and regulation of membrane depolarization mRNA in human breast cancer, suggesting a critical role for the miR106b-25/NEDD4L/NOTCH1 axis in the disease.

These data expand our knowledge of the mechanisms underlying NOTCH activation and regulation of ARF protein signal transduction induction in breast cancer, and may provide new avenues for the development of therapies targeting this resistant subset of tumor cells

entity.text: regulation of ARF protein signal transduction
